attributes.comment:
My husband and I are two time adoptees of special needs children in China. The
process is costly albeit well worth it! However, my sincere hope is that if the fee
for the I-600A is raised, again, then it will remain in effect longer. It is incredibly
difficult and trying to run out of time on the I-171H and have to begin a second
time with additional fees. These children need a home and particulary with special
needs children - they need to join their families as soon as possible. With
government changes happening on both sides of the ocean at a regular pace, it is
heartbreaking and needlessly stressful for parents and child/ren alike to be held
up even longer in the adoption process. If a fee increase is warranted then I plead
you to allow the approval to last up to a minimum of 24 months.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Tina Walrath
